resources.string: %1$s touch restart for a new game!
That\'s not a bomb... game over!
Hi %1$s, let\'s learn to play Minesweeper

The number display button toggles between two options for game play. The surround option displays the number of bombs for the square touched, as well as the numbers in each neighboring square. The individual mode displays only the number of bombs for the square touched.
The reset button clears the board of all moves and randomly regenerates bombs.

The basic goal of minesweeper is to click on all empty squares and flag all bombs. You lose the game when a) you touch a bomb, or b) you place a flag in a square without a bomb. When all squares have been tried and all bombs have been flagged, you win!
